meanings.definition: Take property unlawfully from (a person or place) by force or threat of force.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to rob the bank at night.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often rob convenience stores for money.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon managed to rob the bird feeder of all its seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to rob the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain planned to rob the wealthy merchant ship of its treasures.

meanings.definition: Deprive (someone) of something by deceit or fraud.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist tried to rob the elderly woman of her life savings.
meanings.sent2: Beware of online scams that aim to rob you of your personal information.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun tried to rob the children of their candy on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The magician's sleight of hand seemed to rob the audience of their ability to see the trick.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox managed to rob the henhouse of all its eggs without being caught.

meanings.sent1: The pickpocket managed to rob the tourist of his wallet without him noticing.
meanings.sent2: Thieves often rob cars for valuable items left inside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to rob the picnic basket of its sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The shadows of the night seemed to rob the city of its usual hustle and bustle.
meanings.sent5: The cunning cat managed to rob the neighbor's garden of all the ripe tomatoes.
